channel.title: Valve has gone Harlem! (Update from Valve: "Maybe next year.")
channel.description: Just go to their home page. and wait. :smiley:

item.source: Valve has gone Harlem! (Update from Valve: "Maybe next year.")

item.title: Valve has gone Harlem! (Update from Valve: "Maybe next year.")
item.dc:creator: Johnwalter
item.description:
I am actually happy about this.
They have secretly posted this small info this way
for us dedicated fans.

Think of this, some amater gamer is not gonna check Valve site like once a day.
(no you trolls, i do not check game sites on daily or weekly basis…).

That’s way this is a good idea.It gives us a reason to be patient (although patience
is not our strongest side) and to spread the word softly over the forums.

Imagine what kind of a bomb would that be if Valve was present at E3,
and the only thing they show (after the virtual headset) is a sentence “Maybe next year”.
People would start a riot right then. :cursing:

Read full topic
item.source: Valve has gone Harlem! (Update from Valve: "Maybe next year.")

item.title: Valve has gone Harlem! (Update from Valve: "Maybe next year.")
item.dc:creator: Jake_R
item.description:
KyuuGryphon:

Yeah, not seeing the “Maybe next year” message at all on my end.

It’s on the valve.software url, but it’s got an auto-redirect to the official valvesoftware.com with no waiting time before it, so if your connection is fast enough you probably won’t even see it. =3

Read full topic

item.title: Valve has gone Harlem! (Update from Valve: "Maybe next year.")
item.dc:creator: Johnwalter
item.description:
ummm…I am surprised and amazed what they wrote 8| …they updated the site again.

Valve maybe next year.png1920×1080 81.7 KB

here’s how you can see it.

Go to Valve home page, first link up top.
Quickly watch the top left corner before the page loads up,
where it says:

“Maybe next year.”[/size]

Of course with this they are saying that there will be no games from Valve at E3 or this year.
So the long waiting continues. ;(

Read full topic

item.title: Valve has gone Harlem! (Update from Valve: "Maybe next year.")
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
That’s weird. What’s it doing at the top of google’s results…?

Edit: Doesn’t look like Valve owns it. I think someone just used the weird address to hijack the search results.

Read full topic
item.source: Valve has gone Harlem! (Update from Valve: "Maybe next year.")

item.title: Valve has gone Harlem! (Update from Valve: "Maybe next year.")
item.dc:creator: Johnwalter
item.description:
@Jake R

You’re right.
When you enter the page on google search, you get to https://valve.software/
But when you click on their logo, you get redirected to their home page without
the Harlem Shake.

Curious…might be a prank?
Nah, Valve wouldn’t let someone mess with their stuff.It’s their work definitely.
The question is why?

Perhaps this is some kind of a easter egg?

Read full topic
